tweets.text: In 2017 a new Best Available Techniques Reference Document (BREF) was released. This included a series of Best Available Technique conclusions which come into force for all permits on 21 February. Find out what these mean for you: https://t.co/HIMfJassuv @EnvAgency @NatPigAssoc https://t.co/X65cH5poQF

Please do not attempt to climb over the locked footbridge gate at the River Mersey in #Northenden. The bridge will remained closed until the flood basin water levels have receded further. @EnvAgencyNW will unlock the gate once it is safe to do so. @GMPWythenshawe

#FactCheck - the @EnvAgencyNW flood scheme for #Kendal is taking a whole catchment approach using a combination of natural, semi-natural and engineered approaches - find out more here 👉 
https://t.co/TWU95psTMJ https://t.co/7Mu4hRBZc0

With the #flood levels starting to fall, #Worcester City Council teams are once again in action - in full PPE - to wash down the riverside paths so that you can start to use them again soon for your daily exercise. https://t.co/oaIxs6eNIQ

Read the results of the survey of beach users' health by Featured ESI Academic of the month @dr_anne_leonard: https://t.co/g0GvJNH15k and hear her #esiStateOfTheArt talk on 25 Jan: https://t.co/nxxTzyEUiU
@Ruth_Garside @WillHGaze #ExeterAMR #AMR #ERDF https://t.co/I8SaK7vlRa

Our new fish-friendly pumps in the £35m refurbish of Keadby Pumping Station #Lincolnshire operated very well during #StormChristoph and also helped these eels migrate to spawning grounds. #fish #flood @UniOfHull 
https://t.co/HSnPk29obY https://t.co/Dj8t0NjvH1

Our thermal cameras spotted FOUR beavers out together at @CornwallBeaver the other night... They were grooming each other, known as allogrooming, which maintains their fur to keep them waterproof and well insulated! Find out more with @gillians_voice on #Winterwatch https://t.co/0ZcLya0aBM

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Winterwatch
entity.description: `Winterwatch' continues the BBC's rich tradition of nature documentaries that show off the beauty of the planet and various wildlife species. From their base at the Cairngorms National Park in Scotland, which is twice the size of the Lake District, presenters Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke discover ways that the area's animals survive the challenges that come with winter. With short days, plummeting temperatures and a lack of food, cameras monitor the animals' movements. Beavers, pine martens, golden eagles and red squirrels are among the species featured in the programme.

domain.name: TV Episodes
domain.description: Television show episodes

#Aire trib with @YorksWildlife assessing diffuse pollution & habitat potential. Mix of good, bad & ugly. Much evidence of excessive bank erosion by wooldebeest. Bald meander return of channel to rightful place!

tweets.text: Our @EnvAgencyNW Pump Team met with @johncurtinEA this morning at Didsbury Flood Storage Reservoir. We’ve been pumping 24/7 reducing levels from 95% to <20% in less than a week. This will make sure we are ready for the next storm - hopefully not anytime soon!#TeamEA #PumpAction https://t.co/Lee4eSad2C

We’re continuing to carry out recovery operations following on from responding to #stormchristoph over the past week. The Ouse & Wharfe field team have been out in #Ryther this afternoon with our sweeper to clear up mud from an access road in order to ensure it is safe for use. https://t.co/QN5iBxK0vf

Fantastic climate leadership from @JoeBiden and team today - joining the UK in committing to reach net zero by 2050 and protect 30% of land and ocean by 2030. 

I look forward to joining the President at the Leaders' Climate Summit in April as we work together for our planet.

tweets.text: With more rain expected to fall on already saturated ground overnight, we expect river levels in some of our upper river catchments to rise. Keep up to speed with the latest #flood info & sign up to receive flood warnings at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/nUHvBSlOyX

Awesome seeing the Camping Beck NFM scheme attenuating water above Buxton. Great e.g of a partnership project between @EnvAgencyAnglia and @The_WMA with monitoring expertise from @N_Rivers_Trust, @bcatchment and @Happy_Mapper. Job well done I'd say. 
#NFM #Norfolk #partnership https://t.co/MBHztzpJpB

tweets.text: The old #Foss Barrier gate has been lifted out by crane today as we prepare for the new gate to be lifted into place tomorrow. This is part of our £38m upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to 1,200 properties in #York https://t.co/M1nbHt3mIi

Many of these areas are managed by #IDBs dependent on being able to move flood water into our main rivers. @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury need to allocate the right resources to @EnvAgency for routine management & maintenance of these rivers. @MoretonBack1 @JamesBevanEA @johncurtinEA https://t.co/JkAs91AdZa

WEMBLEY MATTERS:  Brent Council respond to Welsh Harp litter issues after ITN report on the beauty spot's sad state    @welsh_harp @welshharpies  @BrentGreens @BarnetGreens   @anton_georgiou @EmmaJaneWallace            https://t.co/2y0O3VWp1E https://t.co/BgAG3Hc0nX

tweets.text: @agricontract @TomTierney18 @EnvAgency That’s just not true though - compacted soils, bare earth, lack of roughness, damaged wetlands, everyone wanting to get water off their bit of land as quickly as possible. Focusing on dredging is focusing on the symptom not the cause

@suesustainable @agricontract @driverfarms1 @realJohnKempf @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency There are plenty of examples out there of rivers containing sediment where there is no agriculture i.e. sediment deposits will always occur irrespective of land use.
@EnvAgencyNW @MikeAmesburyMP GET DREDGING

Following recent #flooding events in #Northwich and due to further forecasted rain, we have taken the decision to deploy Phase 1 of the Northwich Flood Scheme and erect temporary defences at Barons Quay https://t.co/DByB8F2Rlu
✅ B4211 Hanley Road #Upton now reopen after previous closure due to flooding https://t.co/6aCfgq9yoh
@ilkleyIain @CFEonline @EnvAgencyYNE @LeedsFAS @SustainableLsps @FraserHugill @angusgowthorpe Is there any real world examples that back up the numbers ?
@MarkBowersEA @telfordlive @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA I live in Ironbridge & would just like to say thank you for all you do to lessen the impact of the floods on the people of Ironbridge.

I’ve been in #Dallam again today meeting with @EnvAgency  @johncurtinEA and @WarringtonBC to look at steps needed to protect homes follow the Sankey brook bursting this time banks last week. Pleased to hear a scheme already under consideration. https://t.co/ksGaVOHWun

@InnesThomson @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury @EnvAgency @MoretonBack1 @JamesBevanEA @johncurtinEA The IDB was asked to help, but doesn’t have powers to work on main river and needed to prove benefits, and provide mitigation, for powers to be transferred.
@InnesThomson @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury @EnvAgency @MoretonBack1 @JamesBevanEA @johncurtinEA Rules were relaxed, but multiple owners needed to work together, which proved impossible.
@waterlevels @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury @EnvAgency @MoretonBack1 @JamesBevanEA @johncurtinEA What made it unsuccessful ?

A big thank you to everyone who attend our first #SevernSeries talk last week!🙌💙

You can register now for our second talk on Fri 5th Feb - "Discover the Fish of the Severn" 👇

https://t.co/z8HppAHh0L

tweets.text: @grimmer1895 @EnvAgency Hi there, this looks to be part of the Witham River Walk which is maintained by @town_witham so I was suggest contacting them about the issue. Thanks.

📢 Have you heard about our monthly bulletins in @angling_times? 

Its a great way of keeping up-to-date with the work of @NWFishEA and our fisheries teams across the country!

Catch up on December's edition here 👉https://t.co/HPRLIeTq7j
We are not expecting any impacts but this is being done as a precaution to provide reassurance to the community and protect people and properties from any potential high river levels.

Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost by definition, we are not allowing people to discharge sewage into chalk streams".

Let's just check that statement shall we. https://t.co/tAAPJW9Wge

@InnesThomson @DefraGovUK @hmtreasury @EnvAgency @MoretonBack1 @JamesBevanEA @johncurtinEA Farmers working together to manage their rivers was tested as a pilot in the Brue catchment after the summer 2012 floods, without success.
